title: What are the Baccai compared to Darkin, Ascended and Aspects (and other lore Questions)
body:
With the new Darkin lore which I am loving, we now have yet to see one more, the Baccai, which is only introduced to us by a loading screen narrative tip. With the Darkin lore showing a light on how Ascended, Aspects and Darkin works, we still have yet to see a Baccai. Have these god like beings witnessed a Baccai before? What sort of power do they have if compared to these beings. 
This is the description of what Baccai are from the loading screen tip "In Shurima, those who survived a failed Ascension ritual are known as the Baccai, who often are twisted and malformed."

And for other lore questions, if Azir meets Aatrox, Varus or Rhaast, will he still recognized them? Will they recognize Azir? And will Nasus recognize them as well?

And how does Sivir's weapons work now? Does it contain the souls of the Ascended? Can Sivir hear them? And is Diana basically connected to it now, since Ta'anari combined the power of the Moon (with the help of an aspect of twilight) to defeat the other Ascended?

Sorry for asking too many questions, but There's so much revealed but so many more questions to be asked
{{sticker:sg-janna}}

Wait did I miss the part? Where can I find targon origin part :L

Ascension seems offered to those worthy, even Aatrox thinks this. Varus doesn't seem worth, Xerath and Azir are not either (one stole his the other forced the priests to give it to him). Nasus and Renekton are hundreds of years old at the time of Xerath's ascension, the other Ascended are no doubt as old if not older. 

In the Twilight story it said:
“You saw the Scholar?” said Valeeva, the spines on her back rippling with anticipation. “No one has seen him since he killed Moneerah for delving the charred ruins of Nashramae’s great library.”
If he's willing to kill another just for going into the great library, what do you think he'd do to basically undead Ascended's killing their way through Runeterra?

On the last bit:
"“You all remember this,” he said. “It is the weapon of Setaka, greatest and noblest of us all. Brought from beyond the mountain and raised aloft at Shurima’s birth."
There is only 1 mountain in Runeterra that's seemingly called 'the moutain'. It makes sense, especially also if Aspect of Twilight knew how to use this weapon against Ascendeds.

Ascension used to be offered to the worthy, but the new lore has lowered those standards significantly.

It also created some plot holes. Already in the lore, Ta'anari is old as fuck, and his age is showing through his gray hair, his aching and age-gnarled body (I know he's got battle wounds, but still), and his general tiredness. So given that he's significantly younger than Nasus and Renekton during the time in that story, and he died LONG ago in the history of everything, why aren't Nasus and Renekton battling each other and Xerath with walkers, canes, stray dentures? They should be older than anything imaginable in the current time period, yet they still have the minds and bodies of men in their prime. Why introduce lore that explains that yes, the Ascended get old and show their age, when the current ancient Ascended in the game do not follow this model at all? It's like come on, I get that you're on the narrative team, but you really need to do research and understand your characters and your game before you start writing about. Every author who's writing in an established world knows that they have to do research before making stuff up, or else you're stepping knee deep into plot holes like this that create major inconsistencies.

I wanted to ask this very question a lot earlier, but held off as for most Rioters in California should be asleep during the early hours of the morning. And boy I'm not waiting 10 or so hours before any possibility of a response. 

I hope we get some clarification on the general similarities that the terms Bacci and Darkin have with each other. Bacci was a term for physically twisted Ascended and Darkin seems to have originated as a term for those mentally twisted Ascended, and yet Darkin also began to physically twist their bodies too. So you cant really split the two terms into being slight variations of each other, since 'Darkin' is already suited as an overall description for Ascended who are both physically and mentally twisted. 

If I had to assume 'Bacci' might not be a term meaning to deformed Ascended anymore. It could easily be revised into something else if need be but that's up to Riot.

I feel like they might connect the baccai to the shadow isles if they keep going down the path they are now
